required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Angiocal® in Patients With Solid Tumors, Investigating Safety, Tolerability, Blood Concentration of Study Drug
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-label Study of the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of Angiocal® (PRS-050-PEG40) in Patients With Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if Angiocal® (PRS-050-PEG40) is safe and well tolerated when it is injected into the veins of patients with solid tumors. Other purposes of this study are to investigate how the body of the patients reacts to Angiocal®, how the blood level of Angiocal® develops after injection and how the tumor responds to the injection of Angiocal®.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a phase I, open-label, dose escalation study with Angiocal® in patients with solid tumors using a group sequential adaptive treatment assignment. Patients will be allocated to different dose levels in small cohorts and will receive one single dose application on Day 1, followed by a repeated dosing period. The primary objective of the study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of Angiocal® when administered intravenously to patients with solid tumors. The secondary objectives of the study are the characterization of the pharmacodynamic response, evaluation of the pharmacokinetic profile of Angiocal®, observation of tumor response.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the course of the study
primary_outcome.description: Dose limiting toxicity is determined by recording and evaluating adverse events / toxicity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the course of the study
secondary_outcome.description: AUC_0- τ; AUC_0-tlast; AUC_0-∞; C_max; T_max; t_½; CL; V_z; V_ss; RA_AUC; RA_Cmax; RL; dose normalized values (norm) for AUC_0-τ and C_max will be determined by dividing the original toxicokinetic parameter by the dose level.

secondary_outcome.measure: Development of biomarkers in blood over time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the course of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Response of target lesions over time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the course of the study
secondary_outcome.description: The objective tumor response for target lesions will be presented over time, employing the categories 'complete response', 'partial response, 'progressive disease´ and 'stable disease' and absolute changes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the course of the study
Throughout the course of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Hematology, biochemistry, coagulation parameters, and urinalysis.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the course of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Results of 12-lead Electrocardiogram by time point
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the course of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Changes from the baseline visit will be presented using shift tables (employing the categories 'normal', 'abnormal, clinically not significant' and 'abnormal, clinically significant') and absolute changes in laboratory values, if appropriate. Changes from the baseline visit in QTc between >30 and <60 ms and >60 ms will be listed and summarized separately.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of vital signs from the baseline visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the course of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate, blood pressure and body temperature.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the course of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Any changes in physical examination findings from baseline visit will just be summarized, since the physical examiniations will not result in measurable values.

intervention.description: Single dose of Angiocal® i.v. (intravenous) on Day 1 and further applications of Angiocal® i.v. during a repeated dosing period.

clinical_study.keyword: Angiocal®; PRS-050-PEG40; Solid tumor; Phase I
